description: From Middle French exempt, from Latin exemptus, past participle of eximō.

entries.meaning: Free from a duty or obligation.
examples: In their country all women are exempt from military service.
His income is so small that it is exempt from tax.

entries.meaning: (of an employee or his position) Not entitled to overtime pay when working overtime.
One who has been released from something.
(historical) A type of French police officer.
examples: with this he slipped through the exempts quite unsuspected, and bade adieu to the Lazarists and his honest father […].

entries.meaning: (UK) One of four officers of the Yeomen of the Royal Guard, having the rank of corporal; an exon.

verbs.description: exempt (third-person singular simple present exempts, present participle exempting, simple past and past participle exempted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To grant (someone) freedom or immunity from.
examples: Citizens over 45 years of age were exempted from military service.
